But the question many of my colleagues raised over the past week did not materialize into action. Instead of having the debate many of us in Congress are eager to see, we were presented a resolution Thursday that focused on the president’s decision to take out a terrorist leader.

After 18 years at war without so much as a debate in Congress about the extent to which our men and women in uniform are deployed overseas, @realDonaldTrump's decision to take out the Iranian general last week catalyzed a national conversation between Republicans and Democrats.

Missed amid the partisan fervor following the death of terrorist leader Qassem Suleimani was the unique opportunity it presented Congress to come to a national consensus about the U.S. presence in the Middle East.
